subject: Programming
title: Do One Thing
description: A short lesson to help you apply Do One Thing.

hook.text: A function called 'processOrder' that also sends emails and logs analytics is doing three things.

buildup.text: The Single Responsibility Principle for functions: each function should do exactly one thing.

discovery.text: If you can extract a meaningful sub-function, the original was doing more than one thing.

twist.text: Defining 'one thing' is the hard part. The right level of abstraction determines the boundary.

climax.text: A function that does one thing can be described in a single sentence without the word 'and.'

punchline.text: If you need the word 'and,' split it.

quiz.question: How can you tell a function does more than one thing?
options: You can extract a meaningful sub-function
It has more than five lines
